p: The virus does not pass from pregnant women to fetuses during pregnancy. It appears that transmission does not include vertical routes, such as amniotic fluid, cord blood, or breastÂ milk [ 19]. Approved or clinically proven antiviral drugs recommended for COVID-19 in children do not exist. Clinical management includes prompt implementation of recommended infection prevention and control measures in healthcare settings and supportive management of complications [ 12]. Children should engage in the usual preventive actions to avoid infection, including cleaning hands often using soap and water or alcohol-based hand sanitizer, avoiding contact with others who are sick, and staying up to date on vaccinations, including influenza vaccine.
